intro: Critesion brevisubulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow flower heads that resemble sunflowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Critesion brevisubulatum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with low precipitation.
